The latest installment of the "Resident evil" franchise is here. I am not a huge fan of the series but I am able to recognise their pop corn value. There is something awe-inspiring when it comes to zombie killing spectacle from heroines. Milla Jovovich should be proud since she has evolved into the number one action female lead of all time. She has kicked ass in "The fifth element", "The messenger", 4 Resi films, "ultraviolet", "the three musketeers" and "a perfect gateaway"! Her presence is what solely keep this franchise from becoming a corpse. Not a bad actress at all, she utterly convinces that she is a killing machine. However, the rest of the cast are as wooden as possible although it is not their fault but Anderson's script. Most of the previous characters are back but have nothing to do most of the times or anything alike with their computer alter-egos besides sharing the same costumes.

The plot holes are gigantic, the characters completely one dimensional while their actions are lacking logical explanations and do not even follow the momentum from the previous films. One main baddie even assists Alice to fight off Umbrella who surprisingly still after the zombie apocalypse, has a large number of security guards, laboratories and test facilities that operate completely!? Does these elements mean that the movie is atrocious? No. You just need to switch off your brain, relax and enjoy a string of well-orchestrated action scenes patched together with intense industrial soundtrack and high production values. This is a vast improvement over "Afterlife" and there are many scenes that pay homage to the first entry of the series. It has a constant video game feeling to it, with our heroes going from arena to arena to fight off monsters, zombies and various other monstrosities in destructive and explosive set pieces.

The choreography is pretty impressive (the fight between Alice and Jill has been nicely done) along with excellent production design and action driven music, courtesy of Tomandandy. Anderson's direction definitely has style (the opening credits are all in reverse!) and I really hope for him to start directing other people's scripts besides his own. His dialogue is exposition at its finest with characters just explaining what is happening and where they are going next. No room for character development at all. And it is such a shame really because besides the first RE film, this one has lots of interesting ideas about biohazards and corporations that do not even get any exploration but rather mentioned briefly in a line or two. As I pointed out earlier on, do not expect a solid story. This is nonsense well-made zombie carnage crafted in such a way that won't generate any thinking but it sure is going to be handy for a movie night during winter. And the most positive thing: it looks bigger and has a better pacing than "Apocalypse", "Extinction" and "Afterlife" all together.

+ music, production designer, fight choreography, visuals, nice script ideas, Milla! - script, one dimensional characters, heavy exposition, shame that the ideas are not fully explored

6.5/10

The CGI was pretty good and Mila looks great, but the movie was silly and boring to watch. I've seen all of the Resident Evils and this one was the worst. Some of the fight scenes were good, with good Matrix like action. I never understood in some movies, how you can kick someone across the room and they get up like they were slapped and unfortunately this movie has that kind of fighting. Jill Valentine looked pretty hot in this movie, but her acting really sucked. I would put this one on the director and the writers. I am hoping the next Resident Evil is an improvement, but I am not holding my breath if they do not change directors.

I don't know what everyone is whining about, but get over it. This movie is no worse than the past two or three RE movies that have come out, which admittedly were pretty awful. I actually found this one slightly more entertaining. I thought the acting was on par with previous RE films (take that as you will), except for the actress that played Jill Valentine, whose ham-handed line delivery stunk up the movie. Of course the plot wasn't anything groundbreaking (or all that interesting), but how is this different than any of the other RE movies we've seen since the first one? The premise has always pretty much been the same: Mila Jovovich gets in a hot outfit and lays the beatdown on zombies. You want depth, go rent Doctor Zhivago. You want auteurism, watch some Fellini. This is a very simple formula for a very simple franchise: hot chick, shoots guns, kills stuff. Are you really complaining about the realism of a movie inspired by a video game about mutant zombies? Take this movie franchise for what it is intended to be, and maybe you won't wet your pants with shock and disappointment when the next installment inevitably comes out.

review_title: I'm a fan of the franchise...
"Resident Evil: Retribution" manages to be an action film many will find unbearable to sit through

review_detailed_main: The opening scenes were dope af. Fantastic fight choreography especially those sequences influenced by Asian cinema. It certainly feels more like a video game. The film has many returning actors and characters, along with perfectly picked new characters from the video games, including Ada Wong, Leon S. Kennedy, and Barry Burton, and also a new and improved Jill Valentine, portrayed by Sienna Guillory.

review_title: Can Alice escape from the Umbrella Corporation?

review_detailed_main: I thought this movie was pretty bad compared to the other 4 films. i am a big fan of the games and the movies. i enjoy them both and you can't compare them to each other. anyway, this movie had the potential to be one of the best in the series with all the returning actors, but seriously the acting wasn't terrible but it wasn't very good either. but, the movie just lost what it originally had in the first 4 films. the final fight at the end was just cringing to watch and the movie just failed to live up to my expectations. of course if i find the movie for like $5 i will buy it to complete my resident evil movie collection, but it is definitely my least favorite in the series next to Extinction. who else agrees? i was looking forward to this movie for like a year and a half, i am so let down.

So there is not a lot of story in this. Are you really surprised? What made you think there would be a huge grand story hidden somewhere here? If that's what you're expecting, well you will be more than disappointed. If you go into this expecting to be entertained with great CGI and some good 3-D effects (better than the previous movie, obviously the technical advances come into effect, still not as good as in animated movies of course!).

You'll get some familiar faces (the reason why is explained pretty neat) and some deja vus thrown in. But it's not a best of, of what happened until now. It's a stepping stone to the next movie (don't tell me you didn't see that one coming either!). And it looks like that one might actually fulfill some of what people thought this would be like ...

What can one say about beating a dead horse. Based off the ever popular video game series these movies started out as a super power in the syfy/action saga. Tapping Milla Jovovich (Fifth Element, Resident Evil, The Fourth Kind, .45) being the bad ass lead and being simply gorgeous to boot was clever. The first three films in the series were great success's and did superb at the box office, as I'm sure the rest will and have as well. However, the series has gotten off track and the last two films have been terrible in acting and the CGI is an abomination. Do not get me wrong I love me some Milla and the video game is killer, yet the series needs a drastic overhaul and re-boot if they are going to continue.

Did I mention Milla Jovovich is stunning.

After a major insult by Paul Anderson's latest, "RESIDENT EVIL: Retribution", there's a few words I must say about it. This could be Anderson's worst, perhaps even worse than the mega-flop "AVP". It's a no-brainer, but not a good-to-enjoy no-brainer. It's simply so terribly bad and poorly written, it could easily be compared to some of Uwe Boll's worst. Not to mention the constant and ongoing Paul's masturbation over Jovovich in tight outfits shot in irritating slow-mo, the OVER-THE-TOP-BAD plot. To make things worse, the CG/green-screen scenes are ridiculous, even more than usual. The fourth film installment is actually watchable compared to this one. And I'm not even overreacting. Oh....and Jill Valentine's character seemed to have bigger breasts in the second film. I literally yelled "NO,F****** GOD NO", when I saw the ending. Paul Anderson was sometimes a dirty pleasure for me. But not anymore.

review_title: btw, Resident Evil is bases on the Video Game
More explosions, more bodies and more boredom
review_detailed_main:
THE fifth installment in the Resident Evil series pummels viewers into submission with its non-stop action.

Everywhere you turn, bullets are flying and bombs are exploding. The movie's artificial and glossy look remains, but there is no heartbeat beneath the special effects.

The bullet and body counts probably exceed those in The Expendables 2, and readers know what I thought about the latter.

Alice (Milla Jovovich) does the same thing that she has done in the four previous flicks. She wears her skintight black outfit and arms herself with all kinds of guns known to man, and then she blows up and kills everything and everyone that stand in her way.

You don't need a genius to create a story about her still battling zombies. Just put her in any situation and let her blow her way out her troubles.

Alice now finds herself in a huge Umbrella underwater installation that's conducting Godknows how many tests on the virus that caused the zombie permutation in humans. So viewers find sites dedicated to scenarios such as suburbia, New York, Tokyo, Moscow and Berlin.

Naturally, our intrepid hero and a Chinese agent in a red slinky dress, Ada Wong (Li Bingbing), must go through all these scenarios with their customary gumption. In the process, they rack up a body count that would make male viewers tremble in their shoes.

I presume that Li is starring in her first English movie, because her pronunciation is stilted, but it's certainly better than that of Jay Chou in The Green Hornet (2011).

On the way, Alice discovers the virtues of being a mother when she comes upon a cute female child who's in distress, similar to the kid rescued by Ripley in Aliens (1986). What follows is also similar to that in James Cameron's flick, and Alice even goes to the extent of saving the kid caught and placed in a cocoon.

I'm a little disappointed...no I'm A lot disappointed

review_detailed_main: There's plenty of action, violence and bullets to keep you entertained and just enough of a story to keep the film together plus keep the franchise moving forward. Not a bad experience overall.

review_detailed_main: Really??? Did anyone go trough this script?? What are you spending money on?!? I can't understand how anyone could let this movie go out to public like this! I really loved RE 1-3 but they started messing up on RE4 and now they really hit rock bottom!! The writer seems to be dumb in order to write that! I don't even know if he wrote anything or everyone just went along with it.. Seems so stupid! I hope the next movie will go to someone who is not a complete retard and will write something good. I mean come on, I can write better than that, and even my 6 yo son has better imagination! Watch this movie so you can understand the frustration!
This really isn't the worst film in the series and is actually more interesting than the last 2. But unfortunately, it chooses to focus on the wrong things, on just the action scenes.

Let me count the ways this movie SUCKED. I really enjoy zombie movies. Love Walking Dead. Big fan of the earlier Resident Evil movies. This movie was a huge disappointment. The acting was poor. The scenes looked like they were trying to mimic The Matrix. The action scenes were cartoon-like. This movie has ended my desire to ever see another Resident Evil movie come out. Zombies wielding weapons is one thing. Zombies operating vehicles and dressing in coordinating attire is another. The plot was something that appeared to be written on someone's lunch break. I would give this movie just 1 star but I gave it 2 since there was at least some pretty cool large monsters to see occasionally.

review_title: This is a pure action 1hr SCI-fi movie, not a drama!
review_detailed_main:
I am surprised, and kind-a disturbed by the ignorance of many of the viewers here. You should familiarize with what you are paying for before you spend money on movie tickets, return at home and criticize without understanding the concept.

Let me get some things clear:

* This is an action SCI-FI(=NOT REAL) movie - don't expect realism! This movie could only be compared to the 90's action movies with lots of cool effects. The first movie already set the tone that this is unrealistic story (do you believe that zombies actually exist?). If you want realism, become a volunteer in Iraq or Afghanistan.

* This is a part of s sequence - threat this as another part of the series. Why would you otherwise expect 1hr of references to the old movies, if it is supposed that you already watched them? This is not Star Wars! This part was a pure 1hr action instead of 1hr talks and clichés and like <1 min action. Find out what <<< holism >>> is and apply it to this movie franchise. Maybe then you will understand it.

* Why would you still compare it to the games? If you played the games and expect a movie on the games, basically you will be watching a game play-through. (Then I will be laughing on comments like "well spent money")

The only criticism that I have about the series is that Paul drifted away from the zombies being the main issue to being no obstacle at all and focusing on bigger issues like Wesker and stronger mutants. But I understand his decision. If he dramatizes the zombies every new episode the script would be trivial like those TV zombie series. After all , the main character matures and learns how to kill zombies better.

This is a pure action SCI-fi movie, not a drama!

Are you still confused? Then, probably the RE movie franchise isn't for you.

review_title: Nothing is real, but then nothing gets interesting.

review_detailed_main: I watched this film in 2D so I will definitely rewatch it soon. The opening was cool. Ever since RE3, all the openings were epic. RE5 managed to top the previous ones--with the backwards scene. I liked all the action, it was less Alice and more of other characters including Ada, Leon, Luther, Jill and Rain. Also the new actors were great, Li Bingbing's English is fantastic, and she really looked like Ada. I did not really like Leon because I pictured Jensen Ackles (Dean from Supernatural) to act as Leon (because they are both emo and broody). This Leon is too "not serious" and he does not have a solid stage presence. Alice also looked hotter with age, did anyone notice she looked like Taylor Swift in her "suburban housewife" outfit. The parts I didn't really like is there are no real "zombies". I prefer seeing how normal humans survive in the apocalyptic world and not really action fighters). Also, I notice that RE characters like to move it movie. When Ada and Alice were "hurrying", they strode coolly then when they hear the "standby" they just said "Let's move", which is weird because they were moving already... Leon kept on telling the guys to move... And the first word that Alice said to Jill in RE2 is "MOVE!" The ridiculous "repeatings" of the word move and the totally serious tone they used made it funny. Also, many people were confused whether Alice is an original or not, so the director should show more, instead of suddenly have Ada telling the audience about clones. That being said, RE5 was pure solid action with spectacular sets and really, RE series just keeps getting better and better.

review_title: Such a let down, this is what happens when..
review_detailed_main:
This film is such a let down and by far the weakest in the series, this is what happens when film directors listen to fans on the internet.

I love the Resident Evil franchise and have been a fan since the first game. I was looking forward to seeing Retribution as I knew it continued straight where the last film left off.

The last few films have been really enjoyable but after each film the forums are full of people voicing their own opinions to how the film should be more like the game. When will people realise films fully based on games are terrible! This film looks like the Director has unfortunately listened to the fans and made this film to be a game with level and lives which I feel ruined the film and seems to be any old excuse to get actors the director has worked with in the past back in the film even if they were previously killed off!

The opening sequence was good and I settled into the film but then it takes the route of computer game and the film takes a dive from here.

There is no tension in the fight scenes.

I hope they make another Resi Evil so they can fix everything that is wrong in this film.

review_title: One hour and an half without emotions
review_detailed_main:
I watched the first two movies of the Resident Evil series, then I jump to this, and I'm very disappointed. While the first movie was an innovation, and all scenery was well-made, this chapter looks like a movie that was shot in a empty room and all details are added using computer graphics. This is a loss of realism, I thought I was playing a video game instead of watching a movie. This feeling was amplified by the absence of mimic of the actors, and by the foregrounds, too often used by director.

Secondly, the story is poor: without adding any spoiler to this post, I can confirm that no scary scenes are included, no suspense or twists in the story, but only a great amount of spectacular (and unrealistic) shooting scene. Furthermore think that every spectator can easily predict the following scene.

Finally, the 3D version seen on theater is "flat": there are few scenes with a deep 3D (the opposite of "Avangers" for example), so if you want to see the movie in 2D you don't miss anything.

In conclusion, this movie losses the horror-thriller characteristics of the first chapter and the massive use of computer graphics divides the spectator from dynamic of the movie.

The only thing I can save is the beauty of the actresses.

I should start off this article by first confessing that I am a Resident Evil fan.

Although largely loathed by critics, I have to admit I have always had a soft spot for the franchise, partly because of my love of the games when I was younger and partly because of my love of zombie films.

Being the fifth movie in the series, it was always likely that Resident Evil: Retribution would struggle to deliver a fresh perspective on the zombie-laden franchise.

Ten minutes in and I was beginning to change my mind.

The opening scene of Retribution is a masterclass in aesthetic wizardry, picking up right where the last movie left off it wastes no time in diving headfirst into the action.

Much like the previous Resident Evil movie, Retribution utilises slow- motion visuals intertwined with fast cuts and high-paced action scenes to create a visual feast from start to finish.

For those who have no problem putting their logical thought process on standby for 90 minutes and enjoy a series of action-fuelled, suspense- filled scenes, this movie has a lot to offer.

Resident Evil: Retribution sees Milla Jovovich reprise her role as Alice, once again donning the skintight outfits she has become accustomed to from previous instalments in the series.

The introduction of a daughter plays as an attempt to give Alice a more three dimensional emotive scope, though this attempt is never fully realised and isn't particularly necessary, as it is Alice's hard-headed nature which is one of the most appealing aspects of her character.

A series of other new characters are also introduced along with former characters returning to the franchise for cameo roles.

Fans of the video game will be pleased to see the addition of Leon Kennedy, though he is played by a mediocre Johann Urb and thankfully doesn't end up with too much screen time.

After seeing the previous Resident Evil movie in 3D (and considering it well worth it) I made a point of seeing this one in 3D also, however, as far as Retribution goes, I would recommend passing on 3D and saving yourself the extra money.

Overall I found Resident Evil: Retribution to be very enjoyable, though what disappointed me most about it was the writing.

The plot struggled to hold momentum throughout and the dialogue left a lot to be desired at times, both in writing and delivery.

I would have liked to have seen more zombie hybrid characters introduced also, as most of the zombies present in the film have already appeared in previous instalments in the franchise.

However, with a title like Resident Evil it should already be apparent this film is by no means a masterpiece.

But then again, it isn't trying to be.

What the Resident Evil franchise aims to do is deliver mindless entertainment from start to finish, and on this front it delivers.

what happened to the resident evil movie series? I loved the first few movies but this???? omg this is such a waste of my time... the movie plot is very bad and this absolutely have no story... and the characters speaks like robots!!! I have played the resident evil game as well. i felt like watching a brief video in the game... what we expect from a film is a good story and good acting but this is a total video game... and cant even explain how some characters end up in some places... can any movie be poorly directed than this???? this is the end of the line for me... no use of watching this or any other future resident evil movies... absolute crap!!!!

review_title: Enjoy it for what it is... ENTERTAINMENT.
review_detailed_main: I have read lots of reviews saying this movie lacks plot and is like watching a video game! WELL......The whole "Resident Evil" movie franchise is based off a video game! There is not much plot, a tiny bit of character development, but that is not what you watch this movie for. Like many people say, turn off your brain and enjoy the eye candy. The 3D version is also excellent, with the 3D shot very well and not over used. Settings and CGI are all well created. Zombies look quite generic, but the "Boss" monster is pretty awesome! Not much else to say but highly recommended for any gamers or people wanting some brainless action eye candy!

review_title: Good action but not much characterization.
This Resident Needs to Move Out
"Resident Evil: Retribution" Rewards the Resident Evil Fans with Sci-Fi, Action, Horror, and 3D!
review_detailed_main:
I simply don't get it that some people hate the Resident Evil film franchise for setting up a storyline different to the video game. If they have the same plot, the films will become a 90-minute cosplay skit or a live-action playthrough! The film snobs keep calling this "trash" and "terrible", but let's see if they can generate over $900 million in box office revenue. This is now the fifth film in the franchise and Paul WS Anderson definitely knows what he's doing.

Locations are more diverse than the predecessors. Alice finds herself in Los Angeles's seaside, Tokyo, New York, Moscow, an American suburb, Kamchatka, and Washington DC. The enemies are more and fiercer. The trailer boasts a very large Licker, which is so much better version against the 2002 monster. The 3D is maximized, unlike in Disney's "Frozen". The story runs smooth, though lacking in emotions at times. The action sequences are so better than Marvel's "The Avengers". Jump scares are present. Plot twists include location, characters' fates, and Umbrella's next moves, and they're all awesome. This is the "Resident Evil" film with the most stunts yet, making it high- octane.

Gun reloading is an issue here. But other action movies are guilty of this flaw, so I tolerate the illogic.

Milla Jovovich is an action star and her husband Anderson is an action movie director. Thus, "Retribution" is their best "baby" yet. A positive film reviewer said that this is the biggest and best "Resident Evil" movie yet, I entirely agree with him! I honestly cannot wait for the sixth and allegedly final film that I search for it every week for updates!
The franchise is what it is by a fifth film, you get what you sat down to watch

review_title: The franchise has become a forgettably undead..
review_detailed_main:
I'm a scifi/adventure junkie and will forgive Milla anything, but this is just mindless dreck pandering from one rote scene to the next with a complete absence of anything noteworthy or of interest. And Anderson is obviously too tired of it all to give us any reason to care about either the characters or the story (limited as it is). Overall this installment made 'Doom' seem like a veritable 'Gone With The Wind' by comparison and that isn't easy to do.

With creativity the first casualty after the opening sequence Anderson has undeniably delivered up a movie as forgettable as the most droll of his zombies and leaving franchise badly infected by the banal. Milla deserves better than this and I can only hope Anderson takes better care of her off the screen than on it.

I have always loved the RE series, so as much as I hate to say it, this movie was kind of a let down compared to the rest. Most of the acting was terrible and very stiff and the characters had no real depth, I didn't even care when anyone died because they barley spoke or showed any emotion. Even with Alice I got a different vibe from the previous movies, she was a lot more stiff and her personality didn't really show. There were no real plot twists or "wow" moments for me. I felt like I was waiting the entire time for something awesome to happen and then it was just over.

The action parts were good, but I think they focused way too much on making everything slow motion and a lot of it ended up looking cheesy. Although this one wasn't the best I'm still optimistic for the next one!

I went to the midnight showing, my dad and I have been with the movies every step of the way. I was so pumped to see this one, but maybe after the first thirty minutes I was completely bummed. I even turned over to my roommate and said, "This movie is terrible. It's so bad it's good.

Honestly, my main complaint about this installment is the lack of dialogue. There weren't very many complete sentences, maybe six of them throughout the whole movie? Most from Wesker. That's me exaggerating -- the film is complete madness, the visuals are great and as others have review "complete eye candy." Any fan of the film is of course already on board, but I can only hope that they felt the same way. This movie was terrible-- as a fan I loved it.

You'll make up your mind either way. Don't look for much plot development, character development-- no one is growing, neither is the story. The film leads with a great step into a sixth installment, I can only hope Anderson will grow some respect for the fans and have our characters actually SAY SOMETHING this time.

I don't write many reviews, so I apologize if there is anything wrong with it-- if it's not the greatest.

The 3D is completely worth it... so if you are a fan of three-d movies, check it out.

review_title: Could've been better. Quick review and breakdown.
Some nice action sequences but the story line is getting tired

review_detailed_main:
I've been a big fan of the very first "Resident Evil" movie because it had a unique horror film atmosphere, a twisted story and many intriguing characters. When I saw the second film, I was completely disappointed because it only focused on action scenes and had a very depressing and dumb atmosphere all the time. I disliked the film so much that I stopped caring for the sequels. In addition to this, the fascination of the initial concept has just worn out after numerous comics, novels, video games and movies. I feel that only the closed minded die hard fans will continue buying all this stuff and ignoring the lack of quality that has been replaced by an elevated quantity. As it seems, there are still enough of this people around to carry the whole concept on.

I only watched this movie by pure coincidence as I passed a weekend with a friend who is a fan of the series and who asked me to go to watch this flick at his cheap local movie theatre with him. This new flick didn't inspire me at all to watch the flicks I've had missed or to continue following the series. It just underlines what I've already expected. The movie is filled with numerous action scenes, cheap effects and ultimately leads to another sequel while the characters have no development and while there is also a complete absence of any story whatsoever.

There are still a few good points about this film. First of all, the location of a complex Soviet bunker system somewhere underneath the permafrost of North-East Russia is quite promising and definitely has its charm even if the idea had been used before. The decorations are overall quite stylish and a few shots are in fact very well done. Apart of this, I also enjoyed the simulated places the characters cross in this movie such as Tokyo, New York City or Moscow. These scenes are especially intriguing for people who adore to travel and discover the world as I do and at some moments, there are certain deja-vu effects. As a last point, I might say that I liked the addition of Li Bingbing to the movie. I have seen several Chinese flicks with her before she rose to fame and she definitely is a promising actress. It's sad that she is not acting very much in here in fact just like all the other characters that have no development. She's just there all of a sudden, incarnates a tough woman and shows us her long beautiful legs. That's definitely nice to watch but she has clearly more than just this to offer and the team wasted a lot of promising potential.

In the end, this movie seems to be another continuous step down for the Resident Evil universe. There will be more movies but I hope it will stop anytime soon. While the makers of the comparable Underworld saga were able to pull of a quite decent new flick this year, the team behind Resident Evil fails while it tries. Let's hope for an explosive final chapter before the whole thing will finally be brought to an end. I can only recommend this movie to the die hard fans, anyone else should skip this, watch the first and best feature again and discover more movies with Li Bingbing.

I just saw it today in Imax 3-d and loved it! Forget the reviews from the haters and go have fun! One of the best elements for me was all the different environments (New York City, the suburbs, Moscow, Japan, etc.,). Excellent 3D effects, and the storyline pulled everything from the other movies together, at the same time, if you never saw any of the other movies you could enjoy this one without being lost. I want to go back and see it again on the big screen!

Everyone looked great, plenty of eye candy (for guys and girls). To all the negative reviewers: We know this isn't "Gone with the Wind" with incredible acting and deep characters, it's about a wild ride and fast paced action and it delivers! Thanks to all involved in the making of Retribution!

review_title: Much better than the previous ones!
review_detailed_main:
My review may not be the greatest but I am seriously tired of hearing people complain over and over about the RE franchise. I have played the games and I am fully aware that the movies are not really faithful to the games but does not mean the movie will be an automatic failure.

These franchise is not the greatest but it's entertaining and every time I watch the movies I have a good time. They are mostly unrealistic and inaccurate but it's fun to watch and at the end of the day that's what your looking for.

Now, about this last movie I have to say, from my point of view, this is by far the best one out of the series. Tons of action, zombies, shooting, fighting and nonsense that would leave you satisfied. Glad to have Michelle back, she definitely made the movie better. Definitely looking forward for the next movie and hopefully Paul can somehow bring Michelle back...hey, this movie is pure fiction/fantasy so anything is possible.

review_title: Shameful waste of a great franchise
About what you would expect from a Resident Evil film

review_detailed_main: I knew from the beginning what to expect from this movie. This movie is more or less like the next episode of the previous one. All the action sequences are good but not without drawbacks. If people saw the After life they should have known that in this movie Alice is just like any other human. So if it was gunfight or hand to hand combat they should have taken some care to make her fight smart rather than hard. The storyline was not bad but if they have given some accounts by narration here and there it would been clearer. Resident Evil movies are usually innovative but in this movie there is not a single scene which had that innovative touch. Even with all this I liked this movie.If you want to see this movie and like it then don't expect anything totally new because it is blend of all the movies which came before this one with added rescue op.

When I was watching this in theater, I just can't found a reason why I keeping watching this crap. That's just boring, headless and abusive. I can't even laugh of so much s**t. I gotta say, I like the franchise, at least, I like the three first movies, especially the first one, that featured great action and some horror intense scenes. So I have motives to believe that Resident Evil: Retribution would be a good movie. God, I was wrong, so wrong. Retribution is just one more aleatory action movie, that features a laughable acting and some horrible combat scenes. Shame on Paul W.S. Anderson. If you're not a fan of the franchise, avoid it. If you're a fan of the franchise, avoid it too. Just awful and ridiculous.

Well this is my first Commentary on a Movie. I think i won't tell something important to reveal parts of the Story. Just read and see.

The first Thought i got after i've seen this Movie was why no one tests this Film and maybe criticizes the weak Parts of it. I love Resident Evil from little Boy on till now where Movies of my favorite Game took over.

A really intelligent Introduction with Reversing the Storyline for a perfect reconciliation to the upcoming Story was a real Word to start with. There are nice shocking Effects in the following so that my Mouth couldn't stop smiling. The never ending Action-Scenes are the Stuff what makes this Movie alive. You and of course the actors cant get rid of it.:-)

The Story in general is not bad but could be better. Innovating Ideas in between- but not superior new. In between there are many unnecessary Dialogs which pull the Rating of this Movie down like an anchor. Also gratuitous is the Voice but more the Video Animation of the Red Queen through the whole Film. Finally i'd say this is not the worst Resident Evil but unfortunately I think the 5th Part had to reveal on the Cinemas to be shown. Who likes the Second Part will also like this One. Some nice 3D Effects top off the cinema experience so if you like Resident Evil just watch this One.

review_title: Review by a fan of the games

review_detailed_main:
The opening credits looks so promising. Showing us that we are about to see a large action epic. Despite of its ambitious looks, the movie is still stuck with the same problem of the last film. While the film seems to be cool and fun, the adventure refuses to go further than that. It's big and full of action, but most of them are throwbacks from the previous films. Nobody is actually asking for more than seeing Milla Jovovich slaying these zombies, but sometimes we kind of wish to see something new and interesting here. By its intro, Resident Evil: Retribution is ought to be an extraordinary part of the series. Unfortunately, it rather throw stuff at the audience to keep them distracted.

The ending of Resident Evil: Afterlife promises that the next installment will be bigger and more explosive than ever. In the ads, it shows that this will be some sort of a warfare adventure. Although it's never a good idea to trust movie trailers, the film becomes disappointing when the plot twists into a smaller and cheaper version of the expected one. Instead of being one of the climatic parts of the series, the film is still stuck at being a sequel that only exists because of its gimmicky use of the modern special effects and the 3D. It hardly has a build up to the story and it has more "jumping off the screen" moments than innovations.

Other than its gimmickry, the film brought back some characters from the first three, but only for fan service reason. They also brought some iconic characters from the video game like Leon Scott Kennedy and Barry Burton, but sadly their portrayal is pretty bland. The action just got bigger but there is nothing new about it. We've seen the enemies before. The slow-mos are once again repetitive. It's basically meant to be cool, but in the end it's just another gloss. The only good thing here is Milla Jovovich's fighting, tomandandy's music score, and the special effects.

Just like Afterlife, Resident Evil: Retribution is another unnecessary part of the series. It's disappointing because this sequel did nothing but to show some random nonsensical set pieces and bring back some old characters. Some new characters were introduced but they turned out to be useless. I understand that it's about the action and the fans swallowing the awesomeness but it's the same thing all over again. It's like combining all the memorable elements from the first four films and made it into a large scale action fare in 3D. Overall, it's mediocre and a cash-in nonsense. In the end of the film, it reveals that the next film will be exaggeratedly bigger than this one. I hope the next one will finally step up as a true apocalyptic onslaught than being a repetitive sequel.

review_title: The RE sequel is getting better and better!
stupid Alice and Umbrella Corp.. Awesome 3D effects..

review_detailed_main:
Now even without spoilers I can describe this whole movie perfectly with only one word: FILLER. Simple as that: Nothing happens. Nothing progresses. Especially nothing advances! And even for a filler, a filler could at least have a good story of its own, even if it doesn't connect with the main storyline. Here I can't even say the story is bad, because there is no story at all. They didn't even try.

But we have good effects and plenty of action at least. And that's the whole point I guess: They just needed some empty space to dump them into, and sell it in cinemas. Though those effects are just wasted on this movie, still can be watched once if they are there anyway, but just expect nothing else.

review_title: One of The Best So Far In The Series But Still Not That Good
review_detailed_main:
Just came back from the premier of Resident Evil Retribution and overall an excellent film and in my opinion one of the the best in the series. Although there were a few minor complains that I have

First off, Johann Urb, Kevin Durand and Li Bingbing didn't really fit well into the roles of Leon, Barry and Ada in my opinion and after watching this Leon, I really missed and preferred Chris (Wentworth Miller) and Claire Redfield (Ali Larter) back. Hopefully those guys will return in the next sequel if there is another one. Oh and it was also great to finally see Albert Wesker (Shawn Roberts) and Jill Valentine (Sienna Guillory) turning over to the good side as well although Jill did turn evil for a while. Interesting to see how Wesker fairs off in the next sequel

Overall, an excellent film but character wise a bit disappointing since everyone else in this film apart from Alice didn't make much of a impact to compared to RE:Afterlife. In my opinion, its not a film worth watching again

review_title: LOTS of action, but what's the plot?
review_detailed_main:
'Resident Evil: Retribution' offers lots of action and shootouts galore, but what's the plot? There clearly isn't much to tell in this franchise anymore.

From the very confusing opening to the cliffhanger ending, 'Retribution' has very little substance, but plenty - and I mean plenty - of shooting. Many of the familiar characters from previous installments are back (Rain, Carlos, Jill Valentine, Clarence...), but in very different roles. There simply is no way you can watch this and understand what's going on if you haven't seen the previous films. Hell, I've seen them all and I'm still confused!

Many of the action and events are simulations, and not real, causing further confusion. Alice now also fulfils another role: that of Mother. Yup, mother! But only because of a memory imprint in a little girl (Becky)'s brain. Her capture and rescue scene is so reminiscent of Newt in 'Aliens', it's almost identical. The action scenes are fast-paced and relentless, so action buffs will have a great time with this movie. As for a sequel to a zombie franchise, it is very disappointing. There are hardly any zombies here, and the story itself is...well, erm... there is no plot, really. It's just running, shooting, fighting, running, shooting, fighting, running... you get the picture.

It felt as if the writer/director had too many ideas for one movie - just like 'Resident Evil 2: Apocalypse' - and blended them all together, hoping it would gel. Well, honestly, I'm going to have a difficult time remembering what this film is actually about. It doesn't contribute anything to the series. I will remember all those muscled hunks, though! At least they make the film more watchable. Oh, and Wesker - the ruthless antagonist from 'Resident Evil: Afterlife' - is back, as well, but this time to help Alice.. Ok, talk about confusing...!

review_title: actually I want to give 5 stars, but because of compassion to give him 6 stars and 1 star it is compassion

review_detailed_main:
Each installment in this Resident Evil film series has gotten less and less like the games, and I am not sure if director Paul W. S. Anderson even cares about the games or what he is making, because these Resident Evil films seem to be getting slowly worse with each installment; I did not like the fourth film, so I am at least hoping this fifth installment is at least good enough. The fifth installment directed by Paul W. S. Anderson called Resident Evil: Retribution (2012) was bad with bland performances, bad CGI effects with an occasional practical effect, laughable action sequences, pointless scenes that matter little to the plot, moments that needed more of an explanation, and the editing from scene to scene would occasionally be hard to follow; the movie also had annoying 3D effects that come at you, and the film felt like a rip-off of the Matrix films with how certain characters like Albert Wesker acted and how certain action scenes were executed.

The main character Alice, played blandly again by Milla Jovovich, who is trying to escape this Umbrella Corporation facility, with her just dealing with zombies or mutants trying to find an exit while running into other characters who do not do much but get in the way; Alice barely has any characterization to care about her in any situation, especially since she can flawlessly kill zombies and mutants without any trouble. One of the added characters from the games in this is Ada Wong, played generically by actor Bingbing Li, who looks like the character, but she has no personality to make her an interesting character; also, all her dialogue is badly dubbed over her performance, so the voice does not sound like her real voice and it did not match the any of her lip movements when talking throughout the film. Lastly, the other character from the game that was added was Leon S. Kennedy, played badly by actor Johann Urb, who was just a generic good-looking soldier with no personality; the rest are soldiers made to come and get Alice out of the facility, but also get picked off as they go through each area in the facility that replicates cities or towns around the world.

The antagonists include The Red Queen from the first film taking over what is left of Umbrella and trying to keep Alice from escaping, mostly by taking control of Jill Valentine, played again by Sienna Guillory, who gives a dumb performance and wears a stupid looking outfit the whole film; also, Albert Wesker is in the movie helping Alice escape the facility without an explanation on how he is alive, and actor Michelle Rodriguez is back playing her character from the first film somehow with no reason to how she is alive in any way. The action sequences are laughable with the terrible physics and constant use of slow-motion that was clearly used to pad out the runtime, along with the bad CGI effects, an occasional use of a practical effect, and a bad use of green screen; also, there were a lot of moments that made no sense and would feel like a rip-off of the Matrix films and the Alien films with how the action sequences are executed and cut together, and how some of the mutated monsters would act towards certain characters in the any situation they were in.

The fifth installment Resident Evil: Retribution (2012) was not good with bland performances, bad CGI effects with an occasional practical effect, bad uses of green screen, laughable action sequences, pointless scenes that matter little to the plot, moments that needed more of an explanation, and the editing from scene to scene would occasionally be hard to follow. I tried giving this movie a chance to be good or better than the other films, but it fails as an adaptation based of the games for those who have played the games, and it fails as a regular movie for those who have not played the games; if you have played the games before, do not waste your time with this, and if you have not played the games, I highly recommend that you do instead of watching this.

review_title: I saw improvements, the second best in the series
review_detailed_main: Well, what I saw in this movie is that it seems our director Paul W.S. Anderson took lessons from the mistakes he did in the previous sequels, so made some improvements. What are those? Firstly after the first film, the focus was shifted from zombie battle to some other sub stories and that caused the story to scatter, in other words lost its focus. In Retribution, we come back to the "zombie" horror which is good. The movie has some good zombie action. The first movie was subtle, solid and stylish, then in the sequels, As for the style, it turned into almost garbage. In this installment, Anderson brings some "art". Remember the suburbia scenes which also reminded me Kill Bill. The movie is not subtle may be like the first one, but at least it is stylish and not superficial like Afterlife. Thus, Retribution is not entertainment without "cinema" Yes there are such movies believe me! You may find the story cliché, you may find the movie shallow, you may find the movie average etc. but at least it is not an "empty" movie. Thirdly, Anderson got rid of "Matrix trend" which is good too. This movie has his own action style. Afterlife was lack of real violence and horror, in this one, you will get these! Except for the first movie, especially the second and the fourth one was pretty boring at times because of lack of action. Retribution is almost non stop action! And it is better action. I always hated that all the sequels had a very ugly monster mostly as the climax, this installment has a different (and better) climax! In Apocalypse and Afterlife, there were some ridiculous moments, this movie avoids that and catches a serious tone. And if you liked the giant hatchet scene from the previous movie, the extended version is here, it was a great scene and this time it was not pointless (Sucker Punch logic, good) Michelle Rodriguez, the problem was her character isn't a well written character, so don't expect "Avatar level" However, to see her was real good. As for 3D, it was worthy, but worse than Afterlife and Three Musketeers. I don't know why. In the second half, the movie has some very cliché moments, but not a big deal. And yes, at times, the movie repeats itself, may be it doesn't add anything new, but I've gotten used to that. It has a better direction, better visuals and even a better, more solid script without any ridiculousness and that's enough for me. As said it is better than all of the sequels and it is like almost a masterpiece in comparison with the recent Underworld Awakening. If Anderson plans to make a sixth movie, I hope he can surpass this one, We have enough disappointments.

review_title: The series really, truly should have just ended with 'Extinction.'
review_detailed_main:
After two movies that were enjoyable if flawed to varying degrees, and a third that was a significant improvement and almost genuinely great, Paul W. S. Anderson's 'Resident evil' series descended to a flummoxing nadir with 2010's 'Afterlife.' Troubled from the outset, it got worse and worse as the length advanced until by the end its value had entirely withered away: astonishingly phony, overproduced, and insincere, a cavalcade of tiresome dreck that all but comes off as an effort by the filmmaker to sabotage his own creation. Charging headlong into the fifth movie, again written and directed by Anderson, it's safe to say that my expectations were very low. The first seven minutes and forty seconds seem to bear out those low expectations as we're treated to an action scene played in reverse slow motion, a recap of the series so far, and that same action scene played out again at full speed.

Sigh.

We know the filmmaker can make good films; I'm unclear why he feels the need to make bad ones. We see again in 'Retribution' that the man's predominant ethos of "Slick And Cool" over "Thrilling And Impactful" has taken on life of its own and become his master, for the same issues that dragged down the immediate predecessor are just as surely present here. Overproduced, over the top, plastic, bogus, false, fast pace, slow motion, bad dialogue, bad scene writing, thin and flimsy narrative writing, forceful direction, forced and flat and unconvincing acting, forced plot development, heavy-handed, overzealous cinematography and editing, excessive use of post-production visuals (and looking ever more terrible in the process), dubious costume design, exaggerated hair and makeup: am I missing anything? The horror is only a weak flavor; the action is overcooked and artificial; the science fiction is overbearing. From Tomandandy's original music to the use of CGI, from the way scenes are shot to the way that would-be imposing, fearsome monstrosities are effectively caricatured, this picture was approached less as an action-horror romp and more as a cartoon, or the most dull and stereotypical videogame no one has ever wanted to play.

Takashii Miike's live-action adaptations of manga and anime have been more real; works churned out by Uwe Boll or The Asylum may be better points of comparison than some of Anderson's own past endeavors, but then, Uwe Boll and The Asylum have also made better features than this. Whatever sensible through-line of a plot, continuous through each 'Resident evil' in turn, may have been penned before is now just all but completely abandoned to assemble a haphazard, highfalutin hodgepodge of hollow high-octane hokum, hurriedly hurling heaps of hit-or-miss hoopla and wildly far-flung ideas into something that is recklessly hoped to form something resembling a workable story. That, I should add, is on top of just listlessly borrowing ideas from the previous entries in the franchise. In fairness, I suppose "workable" is an apt descriptor here. "Workable," however, does not equate "something a viewer should care about at a basic level."

Some titles keep one readily invested by one means or another. Others are comparatively light, fare that is entertaining but which doesn't necessitate active engagement. Then there are those titles that are so poorly conceived and/or realized that they actively encourage us to split our attention, for paying heed to our screens is an aggravating, masochistic act of self-torment. 'Resident evil: Retribution' is one of the latter. Anderson should be ashamed himself, and frankly, so should everyone else who participated here. Sparing good ideas receive awful use, and they are far outnumbered by ideas that are just rotten in the first place. Whatever it is one hopes to get out of this - whatever sparing good ideas it might claim - you can find it elsewhere without subjecting yourself to utmost tawdriness. As if 'Afterlife' weren't indication enough, this series really should have just ended on the high note of 'Extinction' instead of pointlessly droning on.

review_title: Yes, we do deserve to get back at someone over this
review_detailed_main:
After utterly failing to live up to the epic cliffhanger the previous one had(adding another to the long list of negative series trademarks), Alice(Jovovich, tough killing machine, like everyone else in this, except she's the only competent one – also, since she's female, sexy, as well. And making up for Afterlife, this one has plenty of her naked, possibly more than the first three combined) wakes up. Several times(presumably to encourage the audience to do the same). She's stuck in an Umbrella(who I swear are part of Aperture, or the other way around – their resource-spending is unbelievably wasteful. Only here, it's not meant to be laughed at. The actual attempts at humor here are trying too hard) facility, has to get herself and others out, the Red Queen is trying to kill her, you know the drill. Yes, this is like the first one, only complete nonsense. It adds in remaining fan favorite characters from the game, and they only share appearance and name with their counterparts. No one has personality in this.

This plays like watching someone play a poor VG – it's all action. Worse still, these set-pieces are overlong, usually uninspired(or rip-offs of better originals, that aren't even passable), and we simply do not care. There's almost no continuity between these, as they change their focus, direction and style. And this certainly doesn't try to give us something to feel anything about. Shoot-outs lack drive, ignore cover and/or has no one ever get hit, fights fare a little better, on account of good choreography and stunt-work. FX are quite well-done, including practical ones. I did not watch this theatrically(it didn't come out in Denmark), so I can't comment on the 3D, but it looks like it might have been enjoyable(if entirely obvious, and like a ride). There are far too many "faces" in this, we're meant to get attached when all we do is recognize them. Clones and simulations explain people coming back from the dead and including Tokyo, New York and Moscow, whilst addressing none of the compelling concepts brought up, and raising more questions than it answers. This barely reaches 82 minutes not counting the end credits(if you do, it's 91), feeling far longer, and somehow finding no place in there for plot or relevance.

The DVD comes with two interesting commentary tracks with Paul W.S. Anderson: #1 joined by Milla and Boris Kodjoe for funny MST3King, #2 with producer Jeremy Bolt, the informational 6 and a half minutes featurette(that contains spoilers) Drop (Un)Dead: The Creatures of Retribution, 4 and a half minutes of hilarious Outtakes, and trailers for BluRay, Resident Evil: Damnation, Total Recall(2012) and Premium Rush. There is a lot of brutal, bloody violence in this. I recommend this to others who ironically enjoy these, for how hypnotically terrible they are. 5/10

review_title: The entire series is based on one incredible absurd premise.
Not as bad as many think...perhaps
By far the coolest opening of the series. This one felt more like a video game and a good addition to the series. I say B.

This review will be pretty short. This is the fifth movie in the series and for those that have watched the other four I'm sure you will end up watching this one too. For those that haven't seen any of them they all tie together so it's best to watch them in order. I will say that this one had the coolest opening of any of them and this one had more of a video game feel then the others as well. Again though this is one that you will already see or not see no matter what I say so I will just say that this was fun to watch and had a ton of action. Overall, another fun and exciting addition to the series. I give it a B.

review_title: A thrill ride that will leave you wanting more!
great effects, same story as always
review_detailed_main:
I always found the Resident Evil franchise very weird to watch. And this is no exception. The effects were always very important and a lot of CGI was/is used but I can take it in such kind of flicks. This part, number 5 already picks in exactly were Resident Evil: afterlife (2010) stopped. And for those who never seen a Resident flick the opening after the credits explains what has happened before.

But just watch the opening. All shown in slo-mo and played backwards. Wow, this I liked very much. And that's what it is all about again. The effects. The story itself is seen before. Alice confused and being attacked, then wakes up at Umbrella as always naked only covered with a small piece. From there she's out to rescue the world again. This time shot in the newest 3D technology. Blu ray players will need to update to see it and it looked great. There's even a small joke hidden for the 3D viewers when some weapon is thrown and really comes towards you, you can even here you throat being sliced by it.

All characters do reappear again here. And new creatures are hunting for victims. I liked it maybe because it clocked in at 95 minutes, sio the action is all around.

Milla Jovovich looked great in her as they say throughout the movie stunning in her SM outfit. I admit, it's the same movements and slo-mo as seen before in other Residents but you like it or not, I did looking out for number 6 already announced...

Gore 1/5 Nudity 0/5 Effects 5/5 Story 3/5 Comedy 0/5

Resident Evil: Retribution - Back to basis. I would certainly recommend this movie because it never disappoint us for its action. But one thing I think they should improve is the storyline. review_title: Terrible. Stop spending money on this.
It's mindless, unrealistic and horribly written in terms of dialog, but damn it, it looks like a whole bucket load of fun.
review_detailed_main:
Resident Evil: Retribution 3D is the fifth installment in the Resident Evil franchise and written/directed by Paul W.S Anderson, whose had a string of bad films throughout his career.

I haven't seen the original few, the only one I saw was the fourth one and this one. The fourth one was alright, as was this one. I'm not a huge fan of action but this was just pure action. It was sort of like a fancy 80's action film. It had terrible acting, no character or plot development, characters I didn't care about, but it looked amazing. When action is done right, like cool slow-mo shots of one person conquering about 100 people, it looks cool. It's mindless, but looks cool. This whole film was mindless but looked cool. It didn't try and be more than it was, it knew it was cheesy, action and it ran with it. It is a bit predictable at times, but all in all, it is enjoyable. It's mindless, unrealistic and horribly written in terms of dialog, but damn it, it looks like a whole bucket load of fun.

A solid 6/10.

review_title: Resident Evil shall end it earlier before becoming worst like this.
Kindly remove this movie from the horror genre....
review_detailed_main:
The movie is opposite to its title name.... Not even a single horror scene only action and action .... i don't understand if you are making a horror movie then why you made such action scenes besides horror scenes.....action was really very awesome but they should added some horror and suspense scenes...

Another big issue about the Zombies ... viewer want to see lots of zombies but in this movie there is just 2 big zombies and some zombie armies which is not so clear .....otherwise there is a war between human and clone ...

In case of characters i really appreciate that they brought some original RE game play characters like Leon and Ada but both was looking sidekick although they are the main character in game play....

Hope in RE6 they put more zombies more horror thriller and suspense scenes with all these characters ..

As a devoted RE fan, I watched and enjoyed every other movies they made until this one. I am utterly disappointed by (1) the script (2) the characters (3) the FX effects (4) the crap they did by diluting the sequels so they can squeeze an extra buck.

I wish I could understand what happened, I really do. I used to say that what they did with RE was terrific, I watched from 1 to 4 countless amount of times and I still find them great. Good amount of horror, the acting's good, the characters are interesting, the storyline is great ...everything was great! For a couple years, they were on my to-watch list.

I think they took their fans for granted : *oh, let's cook a real piece of crap, I bet they'll still be happy and buy the movie* Let's go into details a bit : First : the first 15-20 minutes = What the hell? Everything we took for granted is turned upside-down. As if they wanted to make us believe that what we saw in the previous movies was either in Alice's mind or some cheap TV trick to fool us? I hate when they pull that stunt.

Second : They bring back interesting characters like Rain and Luther so they can do what exactly? Luther dies by some punch in the heart? Hell, the guy survived a freaking zombie army so he can die in such a cheap way? Why did they bring him back? I think they brought back good characters and made them CHEAP really CHEAP.

And, my favorite but not the least ...Becky ...oh Becky. Why should the public care about her? I mean, let's be honest here, they focused on her WAY TOO MUCH, why?????? It's not like your usual fan were soccer moms. She brings nothing to the story. We watch RE to see zombies, fights and MORE ZOMBIES AND MORE FIGHTS. Please stop trying to make us relate to people we don't care about.

Third : The FX effects .. don't get me wrong, I don't mind them at all. But I miss the old bite-them-in-the-neck-or-arm zombie action + they really overused them. The final fight is really an anthem to fx effects ...they really lost me there.

review_title: This film is bad(Please read this like caps lock on)!!!!

Summary of the film:Led lights,Legs,Bad slow motion fight scenes.

Escaping capture from the Umbrella Corporation and heading off with a resistance movement, Alice finds herself and the group under attack by the mutants created by the company and must find a way to stop them before the viruses get out of control.

This here was easily the best of the series and one of the better entries in the genre. This is all to do with the well-reasoned tactic of making this a full-on Action film for the majority of its running time and making the horror come from what's doing all the chasing. The action is pretty much relentless here without much let-up as this is packed with nearly every kind of action here with chases, martial arts, gun-play and stunt-work that almost all the encounters result in and makes for a highly enjoyable time. The initial sequence overrunning the suburban locale as there's all sorts of ravenous zombies infiltrate the house leading to plenty of fun here going throughout the different rooms in a fun, lengthy chase before the escape from the horde outside, the encounter on the car-lined city streets with the blade-wielding monstrous behemoths is an explosive blast with all the crashes, stunt- work and furious fights which is great fun while the big scene here is the gunfight in the computer store that turns into a thrilling car-chase with soldier-zombies and a hulking dog-like gorilla among other monstrosities human and non-human that all offer up plenty of explosive fun which are part of what makes this one so much fun. There's also plenty of fun to be had in the finale as there's even more action here in the massive gunfight in the bay-docks that comes off incredibly well, the chase after the hulking beast is a suitable diversion and there's the exceptionally fun brawling at the end where there's plenty of fine martial-arts brutal action give it enough to matter highly. The other big factors here come from the continuation of this one going for the series' trademark of fantastic creatures and monstrosities that look really great and creepy which makes for quite a fine time, providing enough gore to satisfy as all of these are enough to overcome the lone flaw in this. The one factor to hold this one down is it's absolutely lame CGI used here for the 3D gags and other scenes, oftentimes coming in unnecessarily which proves to be quite a distraction or taking so long to occur that it's possible to forget it was supposed to be one anyway. Beyond this issue, there's more positives than negatives here and overall make this among the best in the series.

Rated R: Graphic Violence, Graphic Language and children-in-jeopardy.

If you like zombie movies you will like this movie. If you just like action you will most likely like this movie. If you like neither action or zombies do not see this movie.

The bad: The acting is on par for most major charters, but for minor charters the acting is sub par; it's not horrible or bad just not good. I would give the overall acing a: "meh". The plot is okay for a zombie movie though it does have a few things and leaves something to be desired. The script can be cheesy at times but its nothing that would make me not like the movie. The action was never bad but it was standard for non-realistic movies; the bullets never ran out unless the script called for it and even though there was some cool flips/kicks I did feel like I wanted more.

The good: The CGI is great giving a bonus to the movie. I am zombie fan so I enjoyed all of the undead, there where not many just regular undead people mostly mutated monsters though. The action had a few good parts, some cool face kicks and heart stopping "palm thrusts". There wasn't anything amazing bout the film I can think of except for the CGI, most of it was just okay.

Bottom line: as I said before if you like zombies you will like this movie. Zombie movies are rare, there are tons of horrible movies about zombies but those are just no fun to watch. If you're like me and a fan of these movies you will understand that an "okay" zombie film is a "great" zombie film because of the rarity. A "great" zombie film is a "classic" zombie film. Because of the scarcity of these movies anything that is watchable becomes enjoyable. This movie is absolutely an okay film id say even a good film which in the zombie lover world makes it a great film to watch so all zombie lovers GO SEE THIS FILM. If you are looking for an action flick this movie could go both ways, the action is decent and almost constant but if you are not interested in zombies, well that's what the movie is all about so I am not sure what to say to you. And again if you neither like zombies nor action and are just looking for a film to watch don't see this film. There are a few bad parts but I expected those knowing the Resident Evil franchise, and a few good parts since it was a big budget picture but mostly everything was just plain old okay. I enjoyed it and wished it was longer but again I'm a zombie fan. I'm giving it a 7 because I think a 6 is too low, but a 7 is too high. 6.5 would be perfect.

TL;DR: Zombie fans: Yes. Action fans: Maybe. Neither: No.

Awful ??? Yes that is !!! This film is really a waste of time and resources. Nothing and absolutely nothing will make sense to you when you'll watch this movie. There is no story and no script at all. Better go watch Tom n Jerry and you won't regret. Now, make no mistake about it, "Resident Evil: Retribution" is dumb in the purest sense of the word. It's an aggressively silly movie in an aggressively silly franchise. We do not expect quality from Resident Evil any longer. We expect our brains to be expunged of common sense and pumped full of endorphins wearing fetish costumes. For that, Paul W.S. Anderson, I thank you.

review_title: Most likely the worst movie ever!

review_detailed_main:
Very heavy on the CGI, which is all very well done by the way, I'm guessing a lot of green paint was used. I think just about every fight sequence was shot in slow motion; I'm not sure why but for me it didn't add any excitement. Nobody will win any prizes for the performances, although I thought Michelle Rodriguez as Rain did a pretty good job. Okay, from an entertainment perspective, yes, it did its job; an easy to follow plot that has plenty of action and some very pretty ladies; this red blooded male was not disappointed on that front. On the down side; it does look like you're watching someone else playing a first person shooter video game. It's left wide open for another sequel (hopefully the last one), so I guess there will be more And I will be watching.

SteelMonster's verdict: RECOMMENDED (Purely for entertainment If this is your sort of thing that is)

My score: 5.7/10

You can find an expanded version of this review on my blog: Thoughts of a SteelMonster.
