This franchise has garnered a strong fan-base, yet each addition has had it's critical lashing but been huge at the box office, grossing just short of a billion over it's five feature run making it the most successful video game adaptation. I will always thank one of my mates for getting me into this series, as each addition has been released these zombie slashing movies have gotten better and better, and Retribution is the defining entry, a magnificent adventure.

Milla Jovovich is back as the ultimate female action hero in "Resident Evil: Retribution", a brilliant addition to the Zombie-Slaying franchise. Some may think this franchise is running on empty, but I disagree, and this entry features a neat twist added to this instalment which will take you by surprise and keeps things fresh (The film is actually set in artificially controlled environments)

Not without it's flaws, there is one moment between Leon and Alice where he tells her not to go after her daughter, it's either the editing here between cuts or the acting, this part felt off key and it's rather cringe, but for every awry line there are plenty of bad-ass lines before and after fights. There are some great stand offs where the characters stare down at each other, there's tension and an element of surprise, getting you ready for the action to explode! And when it does the 3D effects are perfection:- Debris, zombie limbs, gun barrels, bullets and numerous objects soar out the screen at wild speeds, and spectacular depth effects enable the landscape to stretch far into the screen leaving you jaw dropped. Paul W.S Anderson proves yet again that he is the master of 3D immersion, action scenes have never looked so good!

Retribution sees Project Alice continue her battle against Umbrella, who have built a giant facility underwater to further test the deadly T-Virus. Using the virus, Umbrella manipulate the world around her and turn people against Alice, most of whom she used to work with, forcing her to up her game in her mission to finish them once and for all. The cloning plot allows Michelle Rodriguez, Colin Salmon and Oded Fehr to reprise their roles, although they don't have much dialogue they still prove they are worthy to make a comeback.

For me, this movie has one of the utmost best opening sequences ever, it's like watching 3D action-movie perfection unfold on screen: All edited to go in reverse, Umbrella reign hell on the Arcadia ship, every single camera work is an action shot, it is jaw dropping, beautiful, the definition of epic and masterfully constructed, and Tomandandy's soundtrack plays over it upping the scale of awesome to the top.

The Tokyo Corridor of Light fight scene also is one of the best fights I've seen in a movie, the fight choreography is truly spectacular, the editing is swift and cut perfectly making sure continuity flows, which is does perfectly, and the use of 3D here is utterly astounding, in fact a reference quality moment that I'd use to demo my set-up with. Retribution does focus on action more than story, but not at an alarming level, the twists are relatively interesting but obvious yet it pushes the story into exciting territory.

Would I watch this again? Already have, at least a dozen times, with near perfect 3D, tough characters, mind-blowing fight sequences, stunning visuals, a rocking soundtrack and a truly epic finale, Retribution is a soaring entry that hits hard and stands tall in the franchise, it's one of those movies you can watch over and over again, unless you rated it rotten.

review_title: The best worst movie I have ever seen
review_detailed_main:
It's funny I dislike pretty much all the other Resident Evil movies except for this one. It didn't try to be anything special. It capitalized on one simple thing: action. And in that respect it did a really amazing job (in a goofy over the top kind of way). But seriously it wasn't trying to be anything else and I personally liked that.

It's pretty much a video game in movie format. I thought it was really cool and very entertaining. The CGI was pretty well done, the special effects were awesome, the fight scenes were fun. A bunch of boss battles. The best worst movie I have ever seen.

Just for reference I generally like thrillers/mysteries that really make you think and this is certainly not one of those. I did grow up playing video games though so maybe I'm biased.

Nonetheless, this guy liked it.

Now on the fifth movie. Resident evil retribution is yet another action packed movie in the franchise. This time around though our favourite zombie fighting badass is pitted against umbrella as she tries to escape their new underwater facility. The cgi is really good here and the whole building comes to life with the different zones. There are characters new and old back and its a pretty stella cast. Someone that I was surprised to see here was Ada wong. But portrayed as a hero which im happy to see. She is also a great fighter and played by the beautiful bingbing li. Her and alice work well as a team and its really nice to see. So the cast was great. The cgi was good. The plot was interesting enough with good mixes of zombies and human fighting and once more resident evil shows itself as a strong series.
